intro: Duguetia megalocarpa, commonly known as the giant fruit tree, is a tropical plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers and edible fruits. The plant produces woody capsules that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by animals. Its leaves are broad and palmate, and it can grow up to 30 meters tall. The tree plays an important ecological role in its habitat by providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
